# TabletopGame

**Class**

An object that manages the setup and gameplay of a tabletop game.

## Declaration

```swift
class TabletopGame
```

## Overview

First, create a [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup] object that represents your game layout and equipment. Add seats for players to occupy, conforming to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSeat] protocol, and equipment for them to manipulate, conforming to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Equipment] protocol.

Pass an object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/Tabletop] or [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityTabletop] protocol to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TableSetup] initializer.

```swift
let table = Table()
root = createRootEntity(table: table.entity)
var setup = TableSetup(tabletop: table)
```

Implement your structure to initialize the protocol properties, such as `shape`, `entity`, and `id` properties for the `EntityTabletop` protocol.

```swift
struct Table: EntityTabletop {
    var shape: TabletopShape
    var entity: Entity
    var id: EquipmentIdentifier
    
    init() {
        self.entity = try! Entity.load(named: "table/table", in: contentBundle)
        self.shape = .round(entity: entity)
        self.id = .table
    }
}
```

Then, create the `TabletopGame` object that represents your game instance by passing the `TableSetup` object to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/init(tableSetup:version:)] initializer.

```swift
game = TabletopGame(tableSetup: setup)
```

Place the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/localPlayer] in a seat at the table using [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/claimSeat(_:)] or a similar method.

```swift
game.claimAnySeat()
```

Next, implement an object that renders your game layout and equipment. Set the game’s renderer, conforming to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/RenderDelegate] protocol, using the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/addRenderDelegate(_:)] method. Implement the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/RenderDelegate/onUpdate(timeInterval:snapshot:visualState:)] method to render the current state of the game. Alternatively, conform to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/EntityRenderDelegate] protocol.

```swift
game.addRenderDelegate(self)
```

If needed, you can draw a debug representation of selected items in the game using the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/debugDraw(options:)] method.

```swift
game.debugDraw(options: [.drawTable, .drawSeats, .drawEquipment])
```

Then, add actions to the equipment that controls gameplay using the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/addAction(_:)-10j8v] and [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/addActions(_:)] methods.

Finally, pass an object to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/addObserver(_:)] method that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.tabletopkit/documentation/TabletopKit/TabletopGame/Observer] protocol. Implement the `Observer` protocol methods to progress gameplay when players interact with the equipment.

## Creating a tabletop game

- **init(tableSetup:version:)**: Creates a tabletop game with the specified table configuration and version of rules.
- **rootPose**: Update the root pose for the current player
- **update(deltaTime:)**: Update the game manually. Call this function if `automaticUpdate` was not set when registering the Tabletop instance.
- **withCurrentSnapshot(_:)**

## Adding equipment to the game

- **equipment**
- **equipmentIDs**
- **equipment(matching:)**
- **equipment(of:)**
- **equipment(of:forEntity:)**: Retrieves the specified equipment type associated with an entity if it exists.
- **equipment(of:matching:)**

## Managing seats

- **claimAnySeat()**: Claims any free seat. Has no effect if the player is already seated or if there are no free seats.
- **claimSeat(_:)**: Claims the given seat. If provided Seat is not part of the table, it has no effect
- **claimSeat(matching:)**: Claims the given seat. If provided ID does not exist, it has no effect
- **releaseSeat()**: Releases the seat for this player. If the player is not seated it has no effect

## Getting the player

- **localPlayer**: The player who runs this tabletop game instance on their device.

## Adding actions

- **addAction(_:)**
- **addAction(_:)**
- **addActions(_:)**

## Observing actions

- **TabletopGame.Observer**: A protocol for objects that progress gameplay when players take actions.
- **addObserver(_:)**
- **removeObserver(_:)**
- **TabletopGame.ActionCancellationReason**: The possible reasons for cancelling an action or an interaction.

## Jumping to bookmarks

- **jumpToBookmark(_:)**: Restores game to the given bookmark
- **jumpToBookmark(matching:)**: Restores game to the given bookmark
- **bookmarks**

## Starting interactions

- **startInteraction(onEquipmentID:)**: Starts a local interaction. It will return `nil` if too many interactions are already happening at the same time.

## Canceling interactions

- **cancelAllInteractions()**: Cancels all local and remote interactions. This releases control of all the equipment and rolls back all the actions added to the canceled interaction.
- **cancelInteraction(matching:)**: Cancel the local or remote interaction matching the given identifier. This causes any actions added to it to be rolled back, and releases the controlled equipment and any tossed equipment.

## Rendering the table

- **addRenderDelegate(_:)**
- **removeRenderDelegate(_:)**
- **TabletopGame.RenderDelegate**: A protocol for the object that renders your entire game.
- **EntityRenderDelegate**: A protocol for the object that renders your entire game using RealityKit.

## Supporting multiple players

- **attachNetworkCoordinator(_:)**
- **detachNetworkCoordinator()**
- **multiplayerDelegate**
- **TabletopGame.MultiplayerDelegate**: An object that handles players joining multiplayer games.

## Enabling group activities

- **coordinateWithSession(_:)**: Begins coordination of the game with a group session

## Drawing debug representations

- **debugDraw(options:)**: Enable or disable debug visualizations

## Essentials

- **Creating tabletop games**: Develop a spatial board game where multiple players interact with pieces on a table.
- **Synchronizing group gameplay with TabletopKit**: Maintain game state across multiple players in a race to capture all the coins.
- **TableSetup**: An object that represents the arrangement of seats, equipment, and counters around the game table.
- **Tabletop**: A protocol for the table surface in your game.
- **EntityTabletop**: A protocol for the table surface in your game when you render it using RealityKit.
- **TabletopShape**: An object that represents the physical properties of the table.
